line_2: The pride of kings, the care of clowns.

line_1: But every flowing Limb in Pleasure drowns,
line_2: Great Store of Caps, of Slippers, and of Gowns;

line_1: But every flowing Limb in Pleasure drowns,
line_2: Loose, as the Breeze that plays along the Downs,

line_1: But every flowing Limb in Pleasure drowns,
line_2: And waves the Summer-Woods when Evening frowns.
